required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vessel Injury in Relation With Strut Thickness Assessed by OCT
clinical_study.official_title: Vessel Injury in Relation With Strut Thickness Assessed by OCT (VISTA): A Comparison of Vascular Injury Induced by a Polymer Free Sirolimus and Probucol Eluting Stent and a Biodegradable-polymer Biolimus-eluting Stent

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the present study is to determine the relation between vascular injury induced by the stent and strut thickness.

detailed_description.textblock: Thinner struts produce less arterial injury after stent implantation.The objective of the present study is to determine the relation between vascular injury induced by the stent and strut thickness. Vessel injury after stent implantation will be evaluated with optical coherence tomography (OCT). Two stents platforms with different strut thickness (Coroflex ISAR 50 microns and Biomatrix 120 microns) will be compared.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (evaluated after stent implantation)
primary_outcome.description: OCT-based intimal injury score estimated after implantation of the Coroflex-ISAR and Biomatrix DES

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (evaluated after stent implantation)
secondary_outcome.description: Tissue prolapse area assessed by OCT after implantation of Coroflex-ISAR and Biomatrix will be measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (evaluated after stent implantation)
secondary_outcome.description: Stent apposition after implantation of Coroflex-ISAR and Biomatrix as assessed by OCT

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (evaluated after stent implantation)
secondary_outcome.description: Stent expansion will be measured with OCT after implantation of Coroflex-ISAR and Biomatrix

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (evaluated after stent implantation)
secondary_outcome.description: Stent symmetry will be measured with OCT after implantation of Coroflex-ISAR and Biomatrix

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day (evaluated after stent implantation)
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline plaque type will be assessed by OCT (fibrous, fibrocalcific or lipid-rich)

arm_group.description: PCI with a polymer-free dual-drug sirolimus- and probucol-eluting stent (Coroflex ISAR stent) with very thin struts (50 µm). During the PCI, an OCT assessment (baseline and post-implantation) will be performed.
PCI with a biodegradable-polymer biolimus-eluting stent (Biomatrix stent) with 120 µm struts. During the PCI, an OCT assessment (baseline and post-implantation) will be performed.

intervention.description: PCI using a polymer-free dual-drug sirolimus- and probucol-eluting stent (Coroflex ISAR)
PCI using a biodegradable-polymer biolimus-eluting stent (Biomatrix)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients older than 18 years
- Ischemic symptoms or evidence of myocardial ischemia (inducible or spontaneous) in the presence of >50% de novo stenosis located in native coronary vessels
Exclusion Criteria:
- Target lesion located in the left main stem
- STEMI
- Restenosis
- Cardiogenic shock
- Malignancies or other comorbid conditions with life expectancy less than 12 months or that may result in protocol noncompliance
- Known allergy to the study medications (probucol, sirolimus, zotarolimus)
- Pregnancy (present, suspected, or planned)

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital Clinico San Carlos de Madrid
